1AA382ECF7DA4E08851D3A7C974378BA.description: Content Standard 9— Students apply language skills and cultural knowledge in daily life.

9E7A34440C964601BF4FB1287C9F0F44.description:
Comparisons Content Standard 8—Students demonstrate understanding of the concept of culture through comparisons of the
culture studied and his/her own.

558D217023AC4187A9471E949F3A103B.description:
Comparisons Content Standard 7— Students recognize that different languages use different patterns and can apply this knowledge
to his/her own language.

4682D9D0FB0C4B39A8E3103B1CFEC253.description:
Connections Content Standard 6—Students acquire information and perspectives through authentic materials in world languages
and within cultures.

398B8CCEA4044595919C0EE088BF68DD.description:
Connections Content Standard 5— Students reinforce and increase his/her knowledge of other disciplines through world lan-
guages.

2D8D18CE27F64783806F0A02A711DF31.description:
Cultures Content Standard 4— Students demonstrate an understanding of the relationship between the perspectives, practices,
and products/contributions of cultures studied, and use this knowledge to interact effectively in cultural contexts.

Communication Content Standard 3— Students convey information, concepts, and ideas to listeners and/or readers for a variety of
purposes.
